sub_topic: Finding the phase shift of trigonometric functions
message_1: Consider a cosine function given by f(x) = 2cos(4x - π/3). Determine the phase shift of this function.
message_2:
The phase shift of a cosine function in the form f(x) = A*cos(Bx - C) can be found by calculating the value of C/B. In this case, A = 2, B = 4, and C = π/3.

Phase shift = C/B
Phase shift = (π/3) / 4
Phase shift = π/12

The phase shift of the given cosine function f(x) = 2cos(4x - π/3) is π/12.
